Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.view.std

Class StdView

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.view.std.StdView
public final class StdView extends Object
Central class of the console view, responsible for console display.

Comes with console-display related utilities (drawing a line, #setTabulation(int) managing indentation) ...

Defines one method per situation where console display is required.

Special character sequences can be used.

A "/c/" sequence in a menu's String option means "display this entry only in the console view". The sequence itselfs will be invisible

A "/+/" sequence in a String will be replaced by the sum of the current offset and the current tabulation to display all lines after the first one as within a paragraph.

Display requests sent from the Model are supposed to be managed by a DisplayMediator.

Not in charge of collecting any input. See InterruptibleStdInput.

See Also:
  • DisplayMediator
  • ConcreteDisplayMediator
  • Menu
  • fr.sos.witchhunt.view.std

    Fields
    Modifier and Type

    private String
    offset
    This String will be displayed before the String parameter of any display method within this class.
    (package private) int
    tabulation
    When using tabbedLog(String) or tabbedPrint(String), any "/+/" sequence will be replaced by a number of "\t" equal to this field + a number of ' ' characters equal to offset.

  • Field Details

    • tabulation

      int tabulation

      When using tabbedLog(String) or tabbedPrint(String), any "/+/" sequence will be replaced by a number of "\t" equal to this field + a number of ' ' characters equal to offset.

      For example, if tabulation == 2 and offset == "LO02", tabbedLog("Roses are red\n/+/,Violets are blue") will log the following String into the console :

      \t\tLO02Roses are red\n\t\t    Violets are blue

      Allows displaying dynamically-indented paragraphs.

      The "/+/" sequence should not be added to the first '\n' (newline character) of the paragraph.

      See Also:
      • offset
      • tabbedLog(String)
      • tabbedPrint(String)
      • increaseTabulation()
      • decreaseTabulation()
      • setTabulation(int)

    • offset

      private String offset

      This String will be displayed before the String parameter of any display method within this class.

      When using tabbedLog(String) or tabbedPrint(String), any "/+/" sequence will be replaced by a number of "\t" equal to tabulation + a number of ' ' character equal to this String's length.

      For example, if tabulation == 0 and offset == "LO02", tabbedLog("Roses are red\n/+/,Violets are blue") will log the following String into the console :

      LO02Roses are red\n    Violets are blue

      Allows displaying dynamically-indented paragraphs precedented by this character sequence and normalized in terms of indentation.

      The "/+/" sequence should not be added to the first '\n' (newline character) of the paragraph.

      See Also:
      • offset
      • tabbedLog(String)
      • tabbedPrint(String)
      • increaseTabulation()
      • decreaseTabulation()
      • setTabulation(int)

  • Method Details

    • tabbedLog

      public void tabbedLog(String msg)
      Calls tabbedPrint(String) and logs a newline '\n' character.
      Parameters:
      msg - The String to be logged with the current tabulation and offset.
      See Also:
      • tabbedPrint(String)
      • crlf()

    • log

      public void log(String msg)
      Simply calls System.out.println after replacing any "/c/" ("console-only") sequence by an empty String
      Parameters:
      msg - The text to be logged into the console.

    • tabbedPrint

      public void tabbedPrint(String msg)

      - Prints the currentoffset.

      - Prints the tabulation times '\t'.

      - Prints the first line of the given String.

      - Prints all other lines, replacing any "/+/" sequence by offset times ' ' and tabulation times '\t'

      - No '\n' character added at the end, in opposition to tabbedLog(String).

      Parameters:
      msg - The text to display. My contain "/+/" ("Catch-up firstline indentation") special sequences.

    • print

      public void print(String msg)
      Simply calls System.out.print with the given String as a parameter.
      Parameters:
      msg - The String to be displayed with no modifications.

    • stringifyMenuOption

      public String stringifyMenuOption(Object o)

      Converts a single Menu's entry into a String. (Console version)

      The result is generally more verbose than for the Graphical User Interface.

      A Menu's entry is of the Object type. The conversion result will depend on instanceof assertions, testing for a membership to a more specific type.

      A String is displayed as it is, excepted for "/c/" ("Console-only" special sequence), which will be removed.

      An Identity will display a text corresponding to it.

      A TurnAction or a DefenseAction will be translated into a verbose description of the action's effect.

      A Player or a Rumour card will be replaced by the value of their getName() method.

      Parameters:
      o - A Menu's entry (of type Object)
      Returns:
      The String describing the Menu's entry, depending on the classes or enums it is an instance of.
      See Also:
      • Menu
      • Menu::getOptions()
      • makeMenu(Menu)
      • logPossibilities(Menu)
      • Console homologue of the GUI's ChoiceButton::makeButtonText(Object) method.

    • makeMenu

      public void makeMenu(Menu m)

      Displays an Application-scale Menu, (such as the Game's main menu) into the console.

      - Logs the Menu's entitled in UPPERCASE

      - Logs a solid separator.

      - Converts each entry of this Menu into a String and logs it.

      Secondary menus are displayed differently using the logPossibilities(Menu) method.

      Parameters:
      m - The Menu to be displayed into the console.
      See Also:
      • Menu
      • logPossibilities(Menu)
      • DisplayMediator::displayMenu(Menu)

    • logPossibilities

      public void logPossibilities(Menu possibilities)

      Displays a match-scale, secondary Menu, (such as a "Choose the next Player to play" menu) into the console.

      All menus created from model to ask an user to make a choice should be displayed as secondary menus.

      - Logs the Menu's entitled with no modifications

      - Converts each entry of this Menu into a String and logs it.

      Application-scale menus are displayed differently using the makeMenu(Menu) method.

      Parameters:
      possibilities - The Menu to be displayed into the console.
      See Also:
      • Menu
      • makeMenu(Menu)
      • DisplayMediator::displayPossibilities(Menu)

    • logSplash

      public void logSplash()

      Displays a fancy ASCII-art splash.

      Indentation is determined dynamically thanks to the "/+/" ("Catch-up firstline indentation") special characters sequence.

      See Also:
      • The splash is displayed at instantiation.
      • tabbedLog(String)
